item.title: Faith add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Empires do not suffer emptiness of purpose at the time of their creation. It is when they have become established that aims are lost and replaced by vague ritual." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Faith add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Some people—and I am one of them—hate happy ends. We feel cheated. Harm is the norm. Doom should not jam. The avalanche stopping in its tracks a few feet above the cowering village behaves not only unnaturally but unethically." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Faith add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There weren't any curtains in the windows, and the books that didn't fit into the bookshelf lay piled on the floor like a bunch of intellectual refugees." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Faith add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "There is no real ending. It’s just the place where you stop the story." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Faith add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Faith add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm going to take you out of here ... I'm going to take you home, to the world where you belong, where cats with bent tails live, and there are little backyards, and alarm clocks ring in the morning." -- Haruki Murakami
